ext_description.p: A Separate_geometric_tolerance_requirement is a specification that indicates that a set of one or more is to be treated as a separate requirement. That is, when geometric tolerances (excluding the composite profile refinement tolerances and composite feature relating position tolerances) reference the same datum system, all the physical features to which the geometric tolerances are applied are treated as a single pattern with regard to the geometric tolerances. If this type of interrelationship is not desired, the Separate_geometric_tolerance_requirement may be used to specify a set of one or more that are to be treated as a separate requirement.
ext_description.note: Separate requirements are discussed in 4.5.12 of ASME Y14.5M.

ext_description.p: A Simultaneous_geometric_tolerance_requirement is a specification that a set of two or more is to be treated as a simultaneous requirement. That is, the shape elements to which composite profile refinement tolerances and composite feature relating position tolerances are applied are treated as separate shape elements with regard to the geometric tolerances. If this type of independence is not desired, the Simultaneous_geometric_tolerance_requirement may be used to specify a set of two or more that are to be treated as a simultaneous requirement.
ext_description.note: Simultaneous requirements are discussed in 4.5.12.1 of ASME Y14.5M.
